Case_ID.description: A unique identifier assigned to each individual case or study participant.

Tumor/Normal.description: Indicates the type of tissue sample collected, whether it is from a tumor or normal tissue.

Gender.description: The biological sex of the individual.

Age.description: The age of the individual in years at the time of data collection or diagnosis.

BMI.description: Body Mass Index, a measure of body fat based on an individual's weight and height, used to categorize weight status.

Race.description: The self-identified racial category of the patient.
enum: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

Ethnicity_Self_Identify.description: The self-identified ethnicity of the patient, typically distinguishing between Hispanic/Latino origin.

Tumor_Site.description: The primary anatomical site or specific region where the tumor is located within an organ or body part.

Tumor_Site_Other.description: A free-text field providing additional details or specific localization for the tumor site when 'Tumor_Site' is specified as 'Other'.

Tumor_Size_cm.description: The maximum diameter or largest dimension of the tumor, measured in centimeters.

Tumor_Focality.description: Indicates whether the tumor is a single, distinct mass (unifocal) or multiple separate masses (multifocal).

Histologic_Type.description: The specific microscopic classification of the tumor tissue, determined by pathological examination.

Grade.description: The histological grade of the tumor, reflecting the degree of cellular differentiation and aggressiveness, often based on systems like the Fuhrman grade for renal tumors.

Tumor_Stage_Pathological.description: The overall pathological stage of the tumor, typically assigned according to a comprehensive staging system (e.g., AJCC TNM staging) based on post-surgical examination.

Path_Stage_Primary_Tumor_pT.description: The pathological primary tumor (pT) stage, describing the extent of the primary tumor based on microscopic examination, as part of the TNM staging system.

Path_Stage_Reg_Lymph_Nodes_pN.description: Pathological N (Nodes) stage, indicating the extent of cancer spread to regional lymph nodes based on pathological examination after surgery.
